description:
Import Traffic Coordinator

Full-Time - 100% On-Site

Salary: $20 Per Hour

Basic Function

To prepare import/export documents in accordance with established procedures and guidelines; to check shipping invoices for accuracy; may calculate value of duties and tariffs due on transported goods. To perform this job successful, an individual shall be familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within the logistics field. This position relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. The qualified candidate is required to perform a variety of tasks under general supervision. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

  • Enter shipping document information into the system in an accurate manner; generate and proofread data entry printouts for accuracy and correct discrepancies.
  • Track cargo movements and cargo status, including but not limited to sailing status, transit time, arriving discharge, arriving final terminal, last free dates, arriving customer door, empty return, etc.
  • Track and verify status of shipping document release, ocean freight payment and customs clearance; resolve delays and other issues in a timely manner; enter or update status into the system efficiently.
  • Prepare documents related to cargo delivery including but not limited to dispatch order; coordinate cargo delivery by LFD to avoid demurrage and other accessorial charges.
  • Proactively coordinate with carriers, brokers, and customers to ensure on time delivery; continuously find ways to improve Customer Satisfaction in terms of timely delivery as well as empty pickups.
  • In case of diversion, proactively coordinate with carrier, corporate office, and relevant parties and ensure diversions are handled in costs effective ways and input such dates into system.
  • Handle shipping related claims. In case of unavoidable costs, investigate causes of current incidents, implement cost effective solutions and find preventive methods for future.
  • Verify transportation related invoices and enter shipping related events into the system promptly; resolve discrepancies whenever it is necessary.
  • Process payment or billing promptly into system for Finance Department to process.
  • Respond to customer inquires in a prompt and courteous manner; input, verify and maintain costs in the system accurately.
  • Report to supervisor issues that might not be resolved independently, or may cause significant impacts or costs.
  • Obtain competitive quotes including but not limited to transportation, storage rates, trans-loading, in a timely manner. Enter such information into system promptly.
  • Provide Backup to Customs Clearance Specialist as needed
  • Perform other shipping related duties as assigned by the supervisor or the company
  • Perform filing duties each day to include file maintenance on a regular basis.

Job Competencies

Computer Skills

Customer Service

Problem Solving

Result Driven

Self-Development

Strategic Thought

Technical Skills

Education / Training

This position requires an Associate's Degree or its equivalent in area of logistics and/or related area; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Experience

0-2 years of experience in the logistics / import and export field or in a related area.

Preferred

Knowledge and experience with International Import shipments

Knowledge of tracking, tracing shipment
